CrewsOutThere.projDesc: CoT is a fully functioning text-messaging system created for the Bellingham Civil Air Patrol, an auxiliary of the US Air force, intended to get flight crews in contact with each other on short notice.
CrewsOutThere.projMyCont: My primary contribution was to write most of the code found in the crewsOutThere/command folder, primarily these go files: cleanupDB, commandFly, commandParser, commandUtilities, and parserCalls.
CrewsOutThere.projTechUsed: Golang, MySQL, Docker, APIs, Bash, Git, Linux, NetBSD

Deadwood.projDesc: Deadwood is a terminal and GUI game created for my object-oriented design course at WWU.
Deadwood.projMyCont: I acted as project manager, partitioning work to the other team members and organizing meetings. I did the bulk of the programming and design for this project as well.
Deadwood.projTechUsed: Java, JFrame, Git, OOP and design patterns/principles

ATLCompiler.projDesc: I created a compiler for 'a teaching language' as a quarter long project for a Compiler Theory and Design course at WWU. This project consisted of creating an input scanner, token parser, symbol tables for variable, function, and program names, abstract syntax trees for program structure, and code generation to create assembly code based on the AST.
ATLCompiler.projMyCont: I created wrote the entire files for code generation, ASTs and symbol tables and associate headers (defining structures and various important variables). I also added code to the scanner file, creating the regexes that would be used to identify tokens. Lastly, I added all code associated with the context-free grammar in the parser, but did not write the CFG.

ToyOS.projDesc: Created the necessary components of a miniature operating system for an OS class at WWU.
ToyOS.projMyCont: I implemented mutexes, resource management, command line arguments, process and file control, pipes, and the terminal buffers. These were all implemented using C++ classes. Many of these features required complex computations between kernel and user space.
ToyOS.projTechUsed: C++, C, Linux, Operating Systems, OOP

MiniShell.projDesc: A mini terminal developed for a Computer Systems class at WWU. Uses fork/exec to run new processes given to the terminal.
MiniShell.projMyCont: Developed argument parsing for the terminal inputs, created the routine for forking and exec-ing, and wrote functionality for the 'ls -l', 'cd', 'pwd', 'cp', 'touch', and 'exit' commands using system calls.

LPS.projDesc: A solver for linear programs that I am currently developing after taking a Linear Optimization course at WWU. This involves parsing an input file, validating it is a correct linear program, then solving it using the simplex algorithm.
LPS.projMyCont: Created the entire project and continuing development when I have time. I created a scanner and recursive decent parser to get the information from the input program. I will be writing the solver in the near future.

Portfolio.projDesc: A website I made to showcase the projects I have developed over my years of being at Western, both creating projects for WWU courses and personal projects I've made.
Portfolio.projMyCont: Created everything you see on this website, learned web design to do so as I had no experience prior. I also research Spotify and Last.fm APIs to get information about my Spotify profile onto the About-Me section.
